transcript.text: Hello, doctor. I would like to explain my health problem in detail. For the past three to four weeks, I have been having frequent discomfort in my chest. It usually feels like a heavy pressure or tightness in the middle of my chest, as if something is pressing on it. This pain mostly happens when I walk fast, climb stairs, carry heavy bags, or do any physical work. When I stop and rest for a few minutes, the pain slowly reduces. Sometimes the pain spreads to my left shoulder, left arm, neck, and jaw, along with the chest pain, I often feel short of breath. Even small activities like walking for five minutes or going up one floor make me tired. I also feel very weak and exhausted most of the time. During some of these episodes, I start sweating suddenly. Even when the weather is not hot, I feel dizzy and light-headed, and sometimes I feel like I might faint. My heartbeat becomes very fast and irregular during these times. I have also noticed that these symptoms are becoming more frequent and stronger. Earlier, it happened only once or twice a week, but now it is happening almost every day. I have high blood pressure for the last six years and I am taking medicines irregularly. I also have high cholesterol. I smoke around five to six cigarettes per day and sometimes drink alcohol on weekends. I do not exercise regularly, and most of my time is spent sitting at work. Recently, I have started feeling anxious and scared because of these symptoms. At night, when I lie down, I sometimes feel mild chest discomfort and difficulty in breathing. I also wake up suddenly from sleep with a feeling of suffocation. There are times when I feel pain, even when I am resting, especially after eating heavy food or feeling stressed. I also get frequent headaches and blurred vision. My father had a heart attack at the age of 55 and my mother has diabetes. Because of this family history, I am very worried that I may also have a serious heart problem. I have not done any he.

segments.text: Hello, doctor.
I would like to explain my health problem in detail.
For the past three to four weeks,
I have been having frequent discomfort in my chest.
It usually feels like a heavy pressure
or tightness in the middle of my chest,
as if something is pressing on it.
This pain mostly happens when I walk fast,
climb stairs, carry heavy bags,
or do any physical work.
When I stop and rest for a few minutes,
the pain slowly reduces.
Sometimes the pain spreads to my left shoulder,
left arm, neck, and jaw,
along with the chest pain,
I often feel short of breath.
Even small activities like walking for five minutes
or going up one floor make me tired.
I also feel very weak and exhausted most of the time.
During some of these episodes, I start sweating suddenly.
Even when the weather is not hot,
I feel dizzy and light-headed,
and sometimes I feel like I might faint.
My heartbeat becomes very fast and irregular
during these times.
I have also noticed that these symptoms
are becoming more frequent and stronger.
Earlier, it happened only once or twice a week,
but now it is happening almost every day.
I have high blood pressure for the last six years
and I am taking medicines irregularly.
I also have high cholesterol.
I smoke around five to six cigarettes per day
and sometimes drink alcohol on weekends.
I do not exercise regularly,
and most of my time is spent sitting at work.
Recently, I have started feeling anxious
and scared because of these symptoms.
At night, when I lie down,
I sometimes feel mild chest discomfort
and difficulty in breathing.
I also wake up suddenly from sleep
with a feeling of suffocation.
There are times when I feel pain,
even when I am resting,
especially after eating heavy food or feeling stressed.
I also get frequent headaches and blurred vision.
My father had a heart attack at the age of 55
and my mother has diabetes.
Because of this family history,
I am very worried that I may also have a serious heart problem.
I have not done any he.

summary.general_summary: I would to explain my health problem in detail. For the past three to four weeks, I have been having frequent discomfort in my chest. I have high blood pressure for the last six years and I am taking medicines irregularly. Treatment plan discussed with patient.
summary.chief_complaint: I would to explain my health problem in detail. For the past three to four weeks, I have been having frequent discomfort in my chest.
summary.assessment: I have high blood pressure for the last six years and I am taking medicines irregularly.
